chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony B Stephenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

First 60 Days Jail (Straight Time).  Remaining  Huber with standard release conditions.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bail Applied.  Paid In Full.  Remaining bail to be refunded to poster.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Take a Cognitive Thinking Course
Take an Anger Management Course.
No contact with S.W. or Mustang Shellys.

timeConds.notes: Condtion Time:  75 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Credit For Time Served 1 Day.   Last 45 days STAYED.  To commence 07-21-2015 by 12:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony B Stephenson in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy.  Court passes case for the defendant to read the amended criminal complaint.
Case recalled at 3:37.
Plea Colloquy. Court vacates the plea hearing and case remains set for trial.

Defendant Anthony B Stephenson in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Cherella states he is still working on investigation.  Atty. Cherella states that the case may resolve short of trial.  State does not object.  
Atty. Cherella requests bail be lowered.  State is not prepared to address today.  Defense to file a motion.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony B Stephenson in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. will be available for trial.  Case may settle prior.

Jury trial - 12 person on March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Hearing on January 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony B Stephenson in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has been speaking with other attorneys and is narrowing down his choices.  Court will set this matter for trial.  Court will also set a date to check on the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on December 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony B Stephenson in court with attorney Kaivon Yazdani.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Yazdani motions to withdraw.  Defendant states there was a motion to dismiss.  Court notes that is also in the file but today we are only addressing the motion to withdraw.  Additional statements by Atty. Yazdani.  Defendant agrees with motion to withdraw.  Court states it will not get into attorney client privilege.  Defendant requests additional time to obtain an attorney given the holiday season.  Court permits Atty. Yazdani to withdraw.  Atty. Yazdani to transfer file.  Atty. Yazdani states the file has been given to the defendant.  

Court notes that next hearing is on 12-18-14 and believes that is enough time to obtain a new attorney for reasons stated on the record.  If defendant comes into court at the next hearing without and attorney and needs additional time the court will hear argument on why a new date is needed.    Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to provided information to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.
Motion hearing on November 26, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Motion To Withdraw As Attorney filed by Attorney Kaivon Yazdani.
Hearing on December 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony B Stephenson in court with attorney Kaivon Yazdani.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State filed Amended Criminal Complaint charging the defendant with misdemeanors only.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED to the amended complaint. 
  Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
